Pool surveys from different pollsters

Source: R/pooling.R
pool_austria.Rd

Per default, pools surveys starting from current date and going 14 days back. For each pollster within the defined time-frame, only the most recent survey is used.

pool_austria(..., pollsters = c("Market", "Research Affairs",
  "Unique Research", "OGM", "IMAS", "Hajek", "Gallup", "Karmasin"))

Arguments

pollsters

Character vector of pollsters that should be considered for pooling.

See also

pool_surveys

Examples

library(coalitions)
library(dplyr)
latest <- get_latest(surveys_sample)
pool_surveys(surveys_sample, last_date=as.Date("2017-09-02"))
#> # A tibble: 7 x 8
#>   pollster date       start      end        respondents party  percent votes

#> 1 pooled   2017-09-02 2017-08-22 2017-09-02       3055. afd       8.89  272.
#> 2 pooled   2017-09-02 2017-08-22 2017-09-02       3055. cdu      38.0  1161.
#> 3 pooled   2017-09-02 2017-08-22 2017-09-02       3055. fdp       8.52  260.
#> 4 pooled   2017-09-02 2017-08-22 2017-09-02       3055. greens    7.41  226.
#> 5 pooled   2017-09-02 2017-08-22 2017-09-02       3055. left      9.06  277.
#> 6 pooled   2017-09-02 2017-08-22 2017-09-02       3055. others    4.51  138.
#> 7 pooled   2017-09-02 2017-08-22 2017-09-02       3055. spd      23.6   722.
